Romans__04.1: What shall we say then that Abraham hath found, who is our father according to the flesh.
Romans__04.2: For if Abraham were justified <u>by works</u>, he hath whereof to glory, but <u>not before God</u>.
Romans__04.3: For what saith the scripture? Abraham believed God, and it was <u>reputed</u> to him unto justice.
Romans__04.4: Now <u>to him that worketh</u>, the reward is not reckoned according to grace, but according to debt.
Romans__04.5: But to him that worketh not, yet believeth in him that justifieth the ungodly, his faith is reputed to justice, according to the purpose of the grace of God.
Romans__04.6: As David also termeth the blessedness of a man, to whom God reputeth justice without works:
Romans__04.7: Blessed are they <u>whose iniquities are forgiven, and whose sins are covered</u>.
Romans__04.8: Blessed is the man to whom <u>the Lord hath not imputed sin</u>.
Romans__04.9: This blessedness then, doth it remain <u>in the circumcision</u> only, or in the uncircumcision also? For we say that unto Abraham faith was reputed to justice.
Romans__04.10: How then was it reputed? When he was in circumcision, or in uncircumcision? Not in circumcision, but in uncircumcision.
Romans__04.11: And he received the sign of circumcision, a seal of the justice of the faith, which he had, being uncircumcised; that he might be the father of all them that believe, being uncircumcised, that unto them also it may be reputed to justice:
Romans__04.12: And might be the father of circumcision; not to them only, that are of the circumcision, but to them also that follow the steps of the faithful, that is in the uncircumcision of our father Abraham.
Romans__04.13: For not through the law was the promise to Abraham, or to his seed, that he should be heir of the world; but through the justice of faith.
Romans__04.14: For if they who are of the law <u>be heirs</u>, faith is made void, the promise is made of no effect.
Romans__04.15: For <u>the law worketh wrath</u>. For where there is no law, neither is there transgression.
Romans__04.16: Therefore is it of faith, that according to grace the promise might be firm to all the seed; not to that only which is of the law, but to that also which is of the faith of Abraham, who is the father of us all,
Romans__04.17: (As it is written: I have made thee a father of many nations,) before God, whom he believed, who quickeneth the dead; and calleth those things that are not, as those that are.
Romans__04.18: Who against hope believed in hope; that he might be made the father of many nations, according to that which was said to him: So shall thy seed be.
Romans__04.19: And he was not weak in faith; neither did he consider his own body now dead, whereas he was almost an hundred years old, nor the dead womb of Sara.
Romans__04.20: In the promise also of God he staggered not by distrust; but was strengthened in faith, giving glory to God:
Romans__04.21: Most fully knowing, that whatsoever he has promised, he is able also to perform.
Romans__04.22: And therefore it was reputed to him unto justice.
Romans__04.23: Now it is not written only for him, that it was reputed to him unto justice,
Romans__04.24: But also for us, to whom it shall be reputed, if we believe in him, that raised up Jesus Christ, our Lord, from the dead,
Romans__04.25: Who was delivered up for our sins, and rose again for our justification.
